title: Type Addiction?
content:
’ello all )

I’ve been a graphic designer for just over 10 years now, when it comes to type, it’s like the dudes at office “wo there he goes again...”, and the like. I should admit I spend a considerable amount of time reviewing, arranging, browsing, buying etc out of my love of fonts. Let alone publications and blogs, I’

I’m not a type designer after all and I’ve been on penalties from higher management over a couple of purchases (made out of love and liquor). Now I know only a number of fonts can do any project in any given world, but I just cannot stop!

Should i go see a doctor?

comments.content:
If you’re looking for some kind of therapy you may just stick around here.  
Welcome to the anonymous typoholics.
Coming here for a type addiction problem is like an over-eater looking for help at a French pastry shop.
You work for philistines. Keep fighting the good fight, and make sure to leave lots of good specimens laying around.

You may find this similar thread interesting:

[http://typophile.com/node/37118](http://web.archive.org/web/20080207163417/http:/typophile.com/node/37118 "http://typophile.com/node/37118")

ChrisL
’snt really looking for help, rather than measuring up my craze, I don’t work for philistines and would never and yay! it’s nice to meet y’all too.
